meanings.definition: The act of engaging in superficial or materialistic pursuits.
meanings.sent1: Her constant babbittries with designer brands showed her obsession with material possessions.
meanings.sent2: His babbittries with expensive cars and flashy jewelry made him seem shallow.
meanings.sent3: She realized her babbittries with luxury items were getting out of hand.
meanings.sent4: His babbittries with wealth and status blinded him to the true value of relationships.
meanings.sent5: The town's obsession with babbittries left little room for genuine connections.

meanings.definition: A person who conforms to conventional, middle-class values.
meanings.sent1: He was the ultimate babbittries, always following societal norms and trends.
meanings.sent2: The babbittries in the neighborhood all drove similar cars and wore similar clothes.
meanings.sent3: The babbittries at the office never missed a chance to gossip about others.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a babbittries trapped in a cycle of sameness and routine.
meanings.sent5: The babbittries of the group always played it safe and never took risks.

meanings.definition: To conform to conventional, middle-class values.
meanings.sent1: She decided to babbittries and blend in with the crowd to avoid standing out.
meanings.sent2: He would often babbittries to fit in with his colleagues at work.
meanings.sent3: The rebellious teenager refused to babbittries and rebelled against societal norms.
meanings.sent4: In order to be accepted by the group, he had to babbittries and adopt their beliefs.
meanings.sent5: She felt pressured to babbittries in order to be considered part of the community.
